tit.cmt: Miyazu domain と補足しました。

sen.j: 宮津藩（みやづはん）は江戸時代、丹後国与謝郡にあった藩の一つ。
sen.e: Miyazu han is one of the han that was in Yosa County, the Province of Tango in the Edo period.
Miyazu han is one of the han that was in Yosa County, the Province of Tango, during the Edo period.
Miyazu han was one of the han (feudal lord's domain) located in Yosa County, Tango Province, during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: han (feudal lord's domain) と補足しました。Tango Province に修正

sen.j: 藩庁は宮津城（京都府宮津市）に置かれた。
sen.e: The headquarter of the han was in Miyazu Castle (Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture).
The headquarters operation of the han was in Miyazu Castle (Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture).
The headquarters of the han was in Miyazu Castle (Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）、関ヶ原の戦い後に細川忠興が九州へ移されると、丹後国には信濃国飯田城より、京極高知が田辺城 (丹後国)に入り（幕府に届出た正式な居城は宮津城）、丹後一国を領した（丹後藩）。
sen.e: In 1600 when Tadaoki HOSOKAWA was transferred to Kyushu after the battle of Sekigahara, Takatomo KYOGOKU entered Tanabe Castle (the Province of Tango) in the Provice of Tango from Iida Castle of the Province of Shinano (the official residential castle reported to the Bakufu was Miyazu Castle), and controlled a country of Tango (Tango han-domain).

In 1600, when Tadaoki HOSOKAWA was transferred to Kyushu after the battle of Sekigahara, Takatomo KYOGOKU entered Tanabe Castle (in the Tango Province) from Iida Castle in Shinano Province (Miyazu was the official residential castle that reported to the Bakufu), and controlled the country of Tango (the Tango han domain).

In 1600, when Tadaoki HOSOKAWA was transferred to Kyushu after the battle of Sekigahara, Takatomo KYOGOKU entered Tanabe Castle (in Tango Province) from Iida Castle in Shinano Province (Miyazu was the official residential castle that reported to the Bakufu), and controlled the country of Tango (the Tango han domain).
sen.cmt: "the Tango Province" -> "Tango Province" に変更しました。

sen.j: のちに拠点を宮津城に移す。
sen.e: Later the foothold was transferred to Miyazu Castle.
Eventually, the foothold was transferred to Miyazu Castle.
Eventually, the foothold was transferred to Miyazu Castle.

sen.j: 後に嫡男の京極高広を宮津藩に、京極高三を丹後田辺藩（舞鶴藩）に、京極高通 (丹後国峰山藩主)を峰山藩に入れ、丹後に3藩を並立させた。
sen.e: Later the heir Takahiro KYOGOKU was sent into Miyazu han (domain), Takamitsu KYOGOKU was sent into Tango-Tanabe han (Maizuru han), and Takamichi KYOGOKU (the lord of the Mineyama domain of the Province of Tango) was sent into Mineyama han, thereby putting three hans in Tango.

Later, the heir Takahiro KYOGOKU was sent into the Miyazu han (domain), Takamitsu KYOGOKU was sent into the Tango-Tanabe han (Maizuru han) and Takamichi KYOGOKU (the lord of the Mineyama domain of Tango Province) was sent into the Mineyama han, thereby placing three hans in Tango.

Later, the heir Takahiro KYOGOKU was sent into the Miyazu han (domain), Takamitsu KYOGOKU was sent into the Tango-Tanabe han (Maizuru han) and Takamichi KYOGOKU (the lord of the Mineyama domain of Tango Province) was sent into the Mineyama han, thereby placing three hans in Tango.

sen.j: 従って、実質的には京極高広より宮津藩が成立したといってよいだろう。
sen.e: Therefore, it might be said that Miyazu han was substantially established by Takahiro KYOGOKU.
Therefore, it might be said that Miyazu han was substantially established by Takahiro KYOGOKU.
Therefore, it might be said that Miyazu han was substantially established by Takahiro KYOGOKU.

sen.j: 高広の子京極高国は、寛文6年（1666年）、江戸幕府に悪政・一族不和等の不行跡を咎められ、改易となった（宮津藩主京極家自体は高家旗本として存続）。
sen.e: Takakuni KYOGOKU, child of Takahiro was condemned by Edo Shogunate in 1666 for misconduct such as misrule and discord within the families and was deprived of the privilage (the House of Kyogoku as lord of Miyazu han itself existed as Koke-Hatamoto).
sen.cmt: 不行跡→『新和英中辞典』研究社
sen.e: Takakuni KYOGOKU, the child of Takahiro, was condemned by the Edo shogunate in 1666 for misconduct such as misrule and discord within the families, and was deprived of the privilege (the House of Kyogoku as lord of the Miyazu han existed as Koke-Hatamoto).

Takakuni KYOGOKU, the child of Takahiro, was condemned by the Edo bakufu in 1666 for misconduct such as misrule and discord within the families, and was deprived of the privilege (the House of Kyogoku as lord of the Miyazu han existed as Koke-Hatamoto).
sen.cmt: "shogunate" を "bakufu" に変更しました。

sen.j: 天領を経て、寛文9年（1669年）、永井尚征が山城国淀藩より入城した。
sen.e: Through the direct domain of the Edo Shogunate, in 1669, Hisamasa NAGAI entered the castle from Yodo domain of the Province of Yamashiro.
Through the direct domain of the Edo shogunate, in 1669, Hisamasa NAGAI entered the castle from the Yodo domain of Yamashiro Province.
Through the direct domain of the Edo shogunate, in 1669, Hisamasa NAGAI entered the castle from the Yodo domain of Yamashiro Province.

sen.j: 奏者番となった第2代藩主・永井尚長は延宝8年（1680年）、第4代徳川将軍家・徳川家綱の葬儀が増上寺で行われた際、乱心した志摩国鳥羽藩主・内藤忠勝に殺害されるという事件が起こった。
sen.e: There was a incident wherein Hisanaga/Yasunaga NAGAI, the second generation lord who bacame Shoshaban, a middleman between attendants to Shogun, was killed in 1680 by Tadakatsu NAITO, the lord of Toba domain of the Province of Shima, who became raving mad when the fourth generation Tokugawa Shogun family head, Ietsuna TOKUGAWA's funeral was held in Zojo-ji Temple.

There was a incident wherein Hisanaga/Yasunaga NAGAI, the second-generation lord who became a shoshaban (a middleman between attendants to the shogun), was killed in 1680 by Tadakatsu NAITO, the lord of the Toba domain of Shima Province, who became raving mad when the funeral of the fourth-generation Tokugawa shogun family head, Ietsuna TOKUGAWA, was held at Zojo-ji Temple.

There was a incident wherein Naonaga NAGAI, the second-generation lord who had become a shoshaban (a middleman between attendants to the shogun), was killed in 1680 by Tadakatsu NAITO, the lord of the Toba domain of Shima Province, who became raving mad when the funeral of the family head of the house of the fourth-generation Tokugawa shogun, Ietsuna TOKUGAWA, was held at Zojo-ji Temple.

sen.j: 尚長には嗣子が無く、結局は改易となった。
sen.e: Hisanaga/Yasunaga had no heir, and the family was deprived of the privilage after all.
sen.cmt: 嗣子→legal issue[『ランダムハウス英和大辞典』小学館]とありますが、跡取りと考えheirと訳しました。ご検討ください。
sen.e: Hisanaga/Yasunaga had no heir, and the family was ultimately deprived of the privilege.
Naonaga had no heir and the family was ultimately deprived of the privilege.

sen.j: 後に弟の永井直円に大和国櫛羅藩1万石が与えられて再興している。
sen.e: Later, his brother Naomaru NAGAI was given 10,000 koku of Kujira domain of the Province of Yamato to restore the family.
Later, his brother Naomaru NAGAI was given 10,000 koku of the Kujira domain of Yamato Province in order to restore the family.
Later, his brother Naomaru NAGAI was given 10,000 koku of the Kujira domain of Yamato Province in order to restore the family.

sen.j: 天和 (日本)元年（1681年）、阿部正邦が武蔵国岩槻藩より入封するが、元禄10年（1697年）には下野国宇都宮藩に転出している。
sen.e: In 1681 Masakuni ABE entered into a new domain from Iwatsuki domain of the Province of Musashi, but was transferred to Utsunomiya domain of the Province of Shimotsuke in 1697.
In 1681 Masakuni ABE entered into a new domain from the Iwatsuki domain of Musashi Province but was transferred to the Utsunomiya domain of Shimotsuke Province in 1697.
In 1681 Masakuni ABE took over the domain from the Iwatsuki domain of Musashi Province but was transferred to the Utsunomiya domain of Shimotsuke Province in 1697.
sen.cmt: 「入封」の訳は、“took over the domain” で統一

sen.j: 入れ替わりに同地より奥平昌成が入封し、享保2年（1717年）には中津藩に転出する。
sen.e: In exchange, from the same place Masashige OKUDAIRA entered into a new domain, and was transferred to Nakatsu domain in 1717.
In exchange, from the same place Masashige OKUDAIRA entered into a new domain and was transferred to the Nakatsu domain in 1717.
In exchange, from the same place, Masashige OKUDAIRA took over the domain and was transferred to the Nakatsu domain in 1717.
sen.cmt: 'entered into the domain' 「入封」の翻訳が不明瞭ですが、専門用語としてであれば可能かも。翻訳の中で何度も使われています。「入封」の訳は、“took over the domain” で統一

sen.j: 代わって信濃飯山藩より青山幸秀が入封した。
sen.e: Then Yukihide AOYAMA entered into a new domain from Shinano Iiyama domain.
Then Yukihide AOYAMA entered into a new domain from the Shinano Iiyama domain.
Then Yukihide AOYAMA took over the domain from the Shinano Iiyama domain.
sen.cmt: 「入封」の訳は、“took over the domain” で統一

sen.j: 第2代藩主・青山幸道は宝暦8年（1758年）、美濃国郡上藩に移封となるなど、目まぐるしく入れ替わった。
sen.e: The second generation lord Yoshimichi AOYAMA was transferred to Gujo domain, the Province of Mino in 1758; the lord came in and went out at a dizzying pace.
The second-generation lord Yoshimichi AOYAMA was transferred to the Gujo domain (of Mino Province) in 1758; the lord entered and departed at a dizzying pace.
The second-generation lord Yoshimichi AOYAMA was transferred to the Gujo domain (of Mino Province) in 1758; the lord entered and departed at a dizzying pace.

sen.j: 遠江国浜松藩より松平資昌が7万石で入って、ようやく藩主家は定着をみることとなった。
sen.e: Sukemasa MATSUDAIRA entered into the domain from Hamamatsu domain, the Province of Totomi, whereby the house of the domain lord was settled.
Sukemasa MATSUDAIRA entered into the domain from the Hamamatsu domain (Totomi Province), whereby the house of the domain lord was settled.
Sukemasa MATSUDAIRA entered into the domain from the Hamamatsu domain (Totomi Province) with a stipend of 70,000 koku, whereby the house of the domain lord was finally settled.

sen.j: 松平（本庄）氏の家祖・本庄宗資は第5代将軍・徳川綱吉の生母・桂昌院の異母弟ということで大名に取り立てられ、宗資の子松平資俊より松平氏を許された。
sen.e: Munemoto HONJO, the original forefather of Mtsudaira (Honjo) clan, was half brother with Keisho-in, biological mother of the fifth generation shogunTsunayoshi TOKUGAWA, and therefore was promoted up to daimyo, and from Mototoshi MATSUDAIRA who was child of Munemoto the family was allowed to call themselves Matsudaira clan.
sen.cmt: 異母弟→『新和英中辞典』研究社
sen.e: Munemoto HONJO, the original forefather of the Matsudaira (Honjo) clan, was a half-brother of Keisho-in, the biological mother of the fifth-generation shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA, and was therefore promoted to daimyo, and from Mototoshi MATSUDAIRA, who was the child of Munemoto, the family was allowed to call itself the Matsudaira clan.

Munemoto HONJO, the original forefather of the Matsudaira (Honjo) clan, was a half-brother of Keisho-in, the biological mother of the fifth shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA, and was therefore promoted to daimyo (feudal lord), and from Mototoshi MATSUDAIRA, who was the child of Munemoto, the family was allowed to call itself the Matsudaira clan.
sen.cmt: fifth Shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA としました。 大名の後にFeudal lord を追加しました。

sen.j: 当家は7代続き、うち2人が老中、1人が寺社奉行と幕閣の中枢に進出している。
sen.e: This family continued for seven generations, and among them there were some who moved into the nerve center to become high officers in the Bakufu: two people became roju, senior councillors, and one person became the Magistrates of Temples and Shrines.
sen.cmt: 老中→"Japanese History", published by Kodansha
sen.e: This family continued for seven generations, and among them there were some who moved into the nerve center to become high officers in the Bakufu: two people became roju (senior councilors), and one person became the magistrate of temples and shrines.

This family continued for seven generations, and among them there were some who moved into the nerve center to become high officers in the Bakufu: two people became roju (senior councilors), and one person became the magistrate of temples and shrines.

sen.j: 慶応4年（1868年）の鳥羽・伏見の戦いでは幕府方として戦ったが敗戦し、以後は明治政府に恭順した。
sen.e: In 1868, they fought on the side of the Shogunate in the Battle of Toba, Fushimi, and were defeated, and thereafter obeyed the Meiji government.
In 1868 they fought on the side of the shogunate in the Battle of Toba, Fushimi, but were defeated and thereafter obeyed the Meiji government.
In 1868 they fought on the side of the bakufu in the Battle of Toba, Fushimi, but were defeated and thereafter obeyed the Meiji government.
sen.cmt: "shogunate" を "bakufu" に変更しました。

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）廃藩置県により宮津県となり、豊岡県を経て京都府に編入された。
sen.e: In 1871 it became Miyazu Prefecture by abolishing han and replacing to prefecture, then became Toyooka Prefecture, and was incorporated into Kyoto Prefecture.
In 1871 it became Miyazu Prefecture by abolishing the han and establishing the prefecture of Toyooka, so that eventually it was incorporated into Kyoto Prefecture.
In 1871 it became Miyazu Prefecture by abolishing the han and establishing the prefecture of Toyooka, so that eventually it was incorporated into Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 藩主家の松平本庄氏は明治17年（1884年）、子爵となり華族に列した。
sen.e: The house of domain lord, Matsudaira Honjo clan, was raised on to the peerage as viscount in 1884.
sen.cmt: 華族に列した→『新和英中辞典』研究社
sen.e: The house of the domain lord, the Matsudaira Honjo clan, was elevated to the peerage as viscount in 1884.
The domain lord, who was a member of the Matsudaira Honjo clan, was granted a hereditary peerage as viscount in 1884.
sen.cmt: the house' は「家」の翻訳ですが、elevatedされるのは人間なので、英語としては不明確です。The Japanese does seem a little unclear to me, but I have interpreted it to mean that the title is hereditary.

sen.j: 本庄子爵家の祖先である。
sen.e: This is the ancestor of the house of Viscount Honjo.
